course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Exploration of Drawing
course.description: Drawing is a foundational form of communication extending from prehistoric times to the work of modern-day artists and designers. The creative use of lines, shapes, and textures is both a form of expression and a tool to sharpen oneâ€™s thinking and message. In this course, students will explore various types of techniques, mediums, styles, and materials, and learn concepts and history relevant to the fine arts and related industry.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in LANG 1401 OR LANG 1402 OR LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)
